intro: Tetranthera glauca var. laevigata, commonly known as the smooth tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and smooth, glabrous leaves. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments such as rainforests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
